alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 9:53AM EST until December 31 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Passaic and Essex Counties. Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties. For the Passaic River...including Little Falls, Pine Brook, Singac... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 9.4 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Saturday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 7.2 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 12/23/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 9.4 Sat 8 am 8.9 7.9 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EST.
